Build Bundle Installer for macOS Current configuration supports only build for online installer. Build should be migrated from building using cli build command and configuration defined in package.json to electron-builder API. That would let to build online and then bundled installer just by calling builder with dynamic configuration.

CDK Installer doesn't work on Mac OS X Current version is bound to power shell execution to set PATH environment variable for user. 

On Mac OS X it also requires elevated privileges to setup PATH var through modification of /etc/paths file

virtualbox detection does not work on Mac OS X Detection does not work on mac because first steps assume it is windows, where detection done  using environment variable and produces path to VirtualBox installation folder. Under mac it goes different way and uses 'which virtualbox'. It returns path to actual executable file(s) not folder.

Detection doesen't work when running DevSuite.app Detection based on

{code}'which vagrant'{code}

fails to find 'which' util, because of $PATH being different from one set in bash.

https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-execute-node-js-child-process-from-package/4880

DevStudio does not start from installer on Mac That happens because we use .vbs script to copy environment variables to current process so running Devstudio would see them. This is windows specific code and fails on Mac.

Only one MSI installer can be running at the same time Currently with cygwin detection and OpenJDK component uses MSI installer there is running two msi installers at the same time. If that happens only one that starts first succeed all other fails.

Need a new check for existing OpenJDK installed as an msi package Now that OpenJDK is being installed using the msi installer, a new possible issue has arisen:

Basically it's the same problem we had with Vagrant and Virtualbox - one cannot simply try to reinstall msi package into a different folder.

DevSuite Installer should check/warn if Hyper-V is already enabled The platform installer should check and warn if Hyper-V is already enabled on Windows systems.

Hyper-V takes over the virtualization assist hardware, which will keep VirtualBox from being able to start the CDK box which depends on VT-x/AMD-V.

Installer does not remember my selected folder until 'continue' is pressed For some reason installer remembers the selected folder only if it reached the confirmation page.

Log in -> select a target folder -> go back to login -> log in again -> selected folder is back to default

Log in -> select a target folder -> continue -> go back to login -> log in again -> target folder stays the way it was selected

Folder validation does not check if the selected drive even exists I can type in a path to an arbitrary drive that does not exist and continue to confirmation page. Pressing 'Download and install' then does nothing, because it fails on creating the installation folder.

Folder validation inconsistency  - '/' or '\' as the is accepted and resolves to 'c:\' but using '\folder' or '/folder' is not accepted
 - forward and back-slashes are interchangable, meaning you can create valid paths like 'c:\/\/\/\/\/\/a/\/\/\/sd/\/\/\/f\/\/\/g\/\a\/a\/d\///\s\a/a\'

Using a network path in the target folder causes stuttering The target folder validator will check (synchronously) if a directory with the given path exists with every change. Using a path such as //domain/folder will trigger a check that takes about a second or two while the UI stops responding.

installer never completes if left running while screen times out I've tested a few times by installing and uninstalling using the new all in one installer.

If the install process is left on and the screen times out, the installer never finishes installing and stalls at 98-99% for the last three items (namely CDK, JDK and JBDS). 

Not sure if this is a problem specific to this device because I've only tested on this bug logging issue just in case.

Folder selection dialog should consume focus when opened This is an extension of JBDS-3696. Hitting Browse opens a folder selection dialog. At this point nothing stops me from switching back to the main window and clicking whatever UI element I want.

The trouble is that while these elements do not seem to respond when the browse dialog is shown, all the actions get queued up and execute once the dialog closes.

 But wait - it gets better! I can open the dialog and then click a sequence of buttons (like 'continue', 'back' - many times) and it always lands on a different page in the end.

Installer - Installer should check for required free disk space, ala the JBDS installer The current installer is 1.5+GB in size. I have not gotten the installer to run cleanly to a complete installation, but it looks like it requires an additional 4-6 GB. Given that large free space requirement, the installer itself should perform a check and verify that sufficient free space is available before it attempts to perform an install.

Weak startup performance of the all-in-1 installer This is to investigate. I've run the bundled all-in-1 installer on a windows 10 virtual machine with 4GB of memory. It took 1 minute to show the "extract" window.

Browse buttons should not respond when a file dialog is opened Clicking the 'Browse' buttons on confirm page opens a native file dialog. Once open, the user can just navigate back to the main window and keep clicking those buttons. What happens is -  for every click a new dialog is queued up. Once the current one closes the next one in the queue will open. We should not allow this kind of chaining - it is fairly annoying.

CDK plugins installation should not be hardcoded with list of gem file names Installer should iterated over .gem files in cdk/plugins to install plugins instead of hardcoding file names to install. File names have version in it and with new cdk those version change sometimes.

Universal installer step4 Java statement needs updating Universal installer, step 4 states:
"JBoss Developer Studio works with Java 6 and 7 and has been tested with OpenJDK, Oracle and Apple JDK."

According to the approved QE test plan (mojo DOC-932620):
* Only Java 7 and Java 8 are supported for running the IDE (Java 6 support for app development only)
* Apple JDK (which is Java 6) is not supported for running the IDE; it's supported for app development only

For clarity, suggest changing text to:
"JBoss Developer Studio can be run with Java 7 and 8 and has been tested with OpenJDK and Oracle JDK."

JBDS 7.1.1 installer contains jars signed by GTECyberTrust, which may not be installed on all linux systems We have jars in JBDS 7.1.1.GA which were signed using GTECyberTrust. Some linux installs do not include this root cert, so when installing, p2 rejects the cert:

{code}One or more certificates rejected. Cannot proceed with installation.{code}

Full details: https://community.jboss.org/message/866868

*Platform details:*

{code}
Debian Jessie 64 bit
$ uname -a:
Linux Name 3.13-1-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.13.7-1 (2014-03-25) x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ java -version
java version "1.7.0_51"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea 2.4.5) (7u51-2.4.5-2)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.51-b03, mixed mode)
{code}

Note that Debian 8.0 "Jessie" is not yet released nor has a date for release been announced [0]. The latest stable Debian [1] is 7.4 "Wheezy", released on Feb 8, 2014. [2] The description for "testing" releases like Jessie is "Security updates are irregular and unreliable." [3] So... I don't think we support this OS yet. :)

[0] http://www.debian.org/releases/jessie/
[1] http://www.debian.org/releases/
[2] http://www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/
[3] https://release.debian.org/

*Steps to repro on the above platform:*

1. Downloaded jbdevstudio-product-eap-universal-7.1.1.GA-v20140314-2145-B688.jar
2. Ran java -jar jbdevstudio-product-eap-universal-7.1.1.GA-v20140314-2145-B688.jar stuck to the defaults and clicked thru
3. Install failed with an error re certificates not being trusted
4. Log message in ~/jbdevstudio/studio/p2/director/configuration/1396752621141.log  as follows:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine 8 0 2014-04-06 08:21:42.061
!MESSAGE One or more certificates rejected. Cannot proceed with installation.
Installer indicates that Java 8 is not supported See attached screenshot.

The mod_jk module needs more detailed documentation This guide is just about configuring two modules. We document one of those modules really well (mod_cluster), but mod_jk doesn't have the same level of detail. The following items should be addressed in the document:

- Chapter 2, mod_jk should have an overview similar to mod_cluster in Chapter 3.
- Chapter 5, mod_jk should have a working example like we have for mod_cluster
- Appendix A, A.1 is missing mod_jk.so details
- Did we intentionally leave out an appendix section for uriworkermap.properties?

jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl depends on perl(WWW::Curl::Easy) from base-os optional With currently added openssl into JBCS distribution, there was added also {{jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl}} package. Although this package is not directly required to make openssl working in JBCS, customers that want to install it will be required to also install {{perl-WWW-Curl}} package from -optional base-os channel as it is a dependency for it. We should put this information into our JBCS documentation somewhere.

----
Original Jira description follows:

With openssl currently added into JBCS distribution, there is also introduced new dependency on a package from base-os -optional channel ({{rhel-X-server-optional-rpms}}). More specifically, there is added {{jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl}} package, which requires {{perl-WWW-Curl}} which is available from -optional channel.

As mentioned also in JBCS-31, we don't like to depend on packages from optional channel, because of [this|https://access.redhat.com/support/offerings/production/soc], [this|https://access.redhat.com/support/offerings/production/scope_moredetail] and [this|https://access.redhat.com/articles/1150793]; excerpt from latest link:
{quote}
Software packages in the Optional and Supplementary channels are not supported, nor are the ABIs guaranteed.
{quote}

Marking this as a blocker as I believe this should be determined before release.

Fabric8: Is Activemq Load Balancing Cluster topology suggested only for non-persistent messages ? "Load-Balancing Cluster Toplogy is ideal for load balancing non-persistent messages across brokers and for providing high-availability." This is mentioned at 7.3.1. Load-Balancing Cluster, please refer doc[1].

We are not able to understand why it is just mentioned for non-persistent messages. We believe that we should also  append more information so that it is more useful for all of us.
More information should be:

{code}
This topology is most useful if one have a scenario where producer is generating a heavy load but do not really care if all  messages make it to the consumer. This tends to the scenario where non persistent messages are used.  
As this topology doesn't have shared storage so If one is looking for better guarantees regarding delivery, probably best to combine networks and master slave as it is defined in subsequent sections.
{code}

mock_uuid cookie should not be allowed to be empty There is a case where the `mock_uuid` cookie can be empty (an empty string).

https://github.com/feedhenry/fh-js-sdk/blob/master/src/modules/device.js#L16

In this case the uuid should be generated and the cookie should be updated.

fh-component-metrics reports excessive cpu usage if the process is blocked for more than the sample period Currently, if the process is busy and blocking for a long time (greater than 1 second), the read of /proc/<pid>/stat will not happen at the expected timeout of 1 second, and therefore give an innacurate cpu usage. 

See gist here for example of this in action, and how to avoid this by comparing timestamps of the start and end read of the stat file instead.
https://gist.github.com/david-martin/2355ef4ecc3dc26186cb1c89b1e1bb81

Investigate how to solve 'fh:dist' target in grunt-fh-build sometimes missing dependencies if they have been de-duplicated The way that the plugin deals with packing dependencies from the node_modules directory is a bit flawed. The way it currently works is that it matches exactly the {{dependencies}} list from the package.json, and excludes everything else. The reasoning for this was to avoid packing {{devDependencies}}.

The problem with this approach, is that npm (at least some versions of it), may pull up dependencies if they match across more than one subtree, to deduplicate them. One of the features of npm@3+ is that this will be done as eagerly as possible, but it also seems that maybe some versions of npm@2+ will do this in some cases.

That behaviour of npm only becomes a problem with the grunt-fh-build plugin, if a transitive dependency gets pulled up to the top level of the node_modules directory, as it will now be excluded from the built artifact that contains the dependencies, and will no longer exist in the subtrees in which it's depended upon. As you can probably imagine, this issue will present itself a lot more once we move to npm@3+.

I believe this issue should be solvable by using {{npm pack}} and dynamically fiddling with the {{bundledDependencies}} field of the package.json at build time. This probably doesn't sound very nice at first; but if it works as I think it should, I think it would likely be the most elegant solution to our problem, if we want to keep all of our existing functionality.

*Investigation timeboxed to a day*

*Questions:*
* good reproducer for the missing dependencies issue ?
* good regression test to verify we didn't break anything?
* what is scope of changes in grunt-fh-build ?
* what is the scope of changes in package.json of the components ?

*Issues with npm pack:*
* Native dependencies need building which results in a `build` directory (https://nodejs.org/api/addons.html#addons_building). {{npm pack}} excludes this directory from the artifact. The behaviour is not mentioned on the {{npm pack}} documentation (https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/pack) but was found here https://github.com/Automattic/node-canvas/issues/233
* If a native dependency directory is not available in node_modules, {{npm install}} installs the dependency and builds it
* If a native dependency directory available in node_modules but the build is missing from, {{npm install}} does not build it

*Possible solution 1:*
* Extend the fh-artifact cookbook such that when provisioning, after artifacts are extracted, the cookbook finds native dependencies by looking for the binding.gyp files and explicitly builds them
* The build command can either be {{node-gyp rebuild}} or {{node-pre-gyp rebuild}}. If node-pre-gyp can be found in package.json then the latter one is used, otherwise the first one is used. (If a native dependency implements node-pre-gyp, only the node-pre-gyp works. Otherwise, only the node-gyp command works. An example of a dependency implementing node-pre-gyp: https://github.com/MayhemYDG/iltorb/commit/5f25d0559a51e4a2fb76cce9bd08d27964798437)

*Possible solution 2 (implemented):*
* Bundle the directories listed by `npm ls --parseable --production`. This will not include devDependencies

Fix build of ZSTD library The ZSTD library (its native part) seems to be badly built and sending messages with {{zstd}} compression on shoots down the broker. We need to fix the library and rebuild everything with the new version.

Kafka Connect S2I is not reconciling connectors during periodical reconciliation The idea is that when both KafkaConnect and KafkaConnectS2I with the same name exist, the connector reconciliation will be done only for KAfkaconnect which takes precedence. However, the condition in the Kafka Connect S2I operator works in a way that when no Kafkaconnect is found, the reconciliation of connector is skipped. And only when KafkaConnect with the same name exists it will be done. This PR fixes it and does it the right way.

This is later fixed when the status is set. But it looks bad to have the exception in the log because user might not understand it. This PR adds additional status check with exponential back off which backs off when HTTP 404 is returned. That solves the exception and makes the experience better for the user.

Connector operator does not work when Connect is running in a different namespace The connector operator is using only the service name to connect to the Kafka Connect REST API. However that is not enough when the operator does not run in the same namespace as the operator. In that case it needs to use the qualified name {{<connect-service>.<connect-namespace>.svc}}. 

This is opened by [Strimzi#2417|https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/issues/2417]

[DOC OCP] Configuration for external clients is unclear in documentation It seems that every customer who starts to use MQ Streams asks the same question -- what steps must I take to configure access to my installation from outside OpenShift? "Outside" might mean in a different OpenShift namespace, or outside OpenShift entirely.

The information to do this is to be found in the documentation, but it is distributed in a way that makes it hard to assemble a plan of action. For example, there is a section on certificate handling, which is relevant, and a section on setting up routes, which is relevant, but they have no association one to the other in the documentation.

I think the documentation should set out the various ways of connection an 'external' client (both inside and outside OpenShift), listing the costs and benefits of each. It should then expand each option into numbered steps. I appreciate that there will be some duplication of information in doing this, but it will make the process easier to follow.

DMN DT Analysis Misleading rule definition refinements The original definition is:

bq. P tables can be “misleading” when rule contains hyphen  input entry (“irrelevant”) and output is not lowest priority

as in the following example:

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

which was implemented with [DROOLS-3785].

( ref: https://youtu.be/eQRDc6fq2yw?t=1293 )

Further refinements checked to avoid duplicating "Misleading rule" reports when in fact the rules were already reported as "Masked", with: [DROOLS-5368]

However, a table such as the below would inadvertently still report misleading rules:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

So the new definition is refined to:

{quote}P tables can be “misleading” when:
* rule contains hyphen  input entry (“irrelevant”)
* and output is not lowest priority
* the hyphen in the misleading rule, correspond to a value (not an hyphen) in the mislead('d) rule
{quote}

DMN strongly typed class compile errors for collection types If we have an itemDefinition with isCollection="true", it will cause a compile error for InputSet and OutputSet when typesafe is enabled. Note that itemComponent with isCollection="true" works fine.

    DMNRuntimeTypesTest.testCollectionType()

{code:xml}
  <semantic:itemDefinition label="tPersonList" name="tPersonList" isCollection="true">
    <semantic:typeRef>tPerson</semantic:typeRef>
  </semantic:itemDefinition>
{code}

Consider separating TypeSafe specific tests:
https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/pull/2993#discussion_r463500865

DMN strongly typed class compile errors for capitalized/non-capitalized properties conflict If we have node names where the difference is only "First letter is capitalized or not" (e.g. "myPerson" and "MyPerson"), it will cause a compile error for InputSet and OutputSet. Note that it works fine without typesafe.

- DMNRuntimeTypesTest.testCapitalLetterConflict()
- DMNRuntimeTypesTest.testCapitalLetterConflictWithInputAndDecision()

https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/pull/2993#discussion_r456300584

[DMN Designer] Code Completion - When users press Escape on suggestions the edit mode is closed This bug was created by this comment: https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/pull/3000#issuecomment-553442743

{quote}*Reported by Jozef:*
Once completions are shown, then pressing Escape hides them however cancel also edit mode of the cell, I am not sure what customers will think about this.
{quote}
Check with UX the expected behaviour, and implement the expected behaviour for the Escape key in the described case


The severity of the issue is higher if we follow this steps:
- Put some value into cell, confirm it == finish edit mode
- Edit the same cell, type new expression
- Very probably autocompletions will be shown
- However imagine you do not want to use any hint, so you press *Escape*
- Now the completions are hidden, however also edit mode was canceled and typed value was not stored

[DMN Designer] Grid performance is dire There have been reports that the performance of the DMN editor's grids does not scale. On examination performance for anything other than simple examples is pretty dire.. something is seriously wrong.

On closer inspection the following issues were found:
- Multiple {{NodeMouseDownHandler}}, {{NodeMouseMoveHandler}} and {{NodeMouseUpHandler}} are registered because multiple {{DMNGridLayer}} are (incorrectly) instantiated due to a flaw in {{GridLienzoPanel}} and {{GridLienzoScrollHandler}}.
- Calls to {{GridWidget.getHeight()}} and {{GridRow.getHeight()}} can be _very_ expensive for due to the dynamic calculation in {{ExpressionEditorGridRow}} and {{LiteralExpressionGridRow}} rows.

[DMN Designer] Support Decision Service invocation User is not able to model a DMN model where he declare a Decision service and invoke this Decision Service from other node, because the Decision Service node doesn't allow any incoming nor outgoing connections.

h2. Acceptance criteria
- Import attached model *a1*
- Connect *mood* decision service and *Decision-1* decision node
- Deploy the model
- Try to evaluate model via a rest call
- Check the output json doesn't contain  [^error.log] 
- Check the server log doesn't contain  [^server-error.log]

Cancel Scenario Simulation edit mode User is able to edit grid cell by pressing an enter. Currently the edit mode is cancelled by *Shift + Tab* combination. We have to change this to:
- *Tab* for cancel edit mode and *store* the value
- *Esc* for cancel edit mode and *discard* the value

This defect is caused by keyboard shortcuts implemented as part of DROOLS-2932.

Edit Scenario Simulation data cells constraint It should not be possible to edit cells in columns whose type has not been set yet; these cells contain the Define valid type placeholder. Once you edit such a cell (you fill in any value) and then remove the value, the cell placeholder switches to Insert value, which is not correct. These cells should not be editable at all.

This defect is caused by keyboard shortcuts implemented as part of DROOLS-2932.
Edit Scenario Simulation row number It should not be possible to edit the cells with row numbers. However it is using keyboard shortcuts implemented as part of DROOLS-2932.

[DMN Designer] Do not add Header to nested ContextGrid During the work [~jomarko] is doing for [DROOLS-2932|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DROOLS-2932] it became apparent that _hiding_ the {{Header}} for a _nested_ {{ContextGrid}} is wrong; as it allows keyboard navigation into the (invisible) {{Header}}. We should not add a {{Header}} at all for _nested_ {{ContextGrid}}.

DMN DRGElement typeRef to allow FEEL Any

[DMN Designer] Information Item name is empty by default The properties of decision has two sections with *Name* property. One general *Decision Name* and one *Information Item Name*.

The second *Information Item Name* reflects in <variable/> tag of the backing xml file. Its value important for the runtime.

I think we should solve this issue doing two actions:
- Make *Information Item Name* readonly
- Set *Information Item Name* automatically according to *Decision Name*

[DMN Designer] Add support for optional typeRefs At the moment {{TypeRef}} is a mandatory field within the editor.

This is a hard limitation of use of the Properties Panel bean-binding (it cannot bind to {{null}} values). However the DMN Specification states that {{TypeRef}} are optional (and we are working around by changing the _default_ to {{Any}} - see [DROOLS-3248|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DROOLS-3248]).

We need to change the UI and marshaller to be able to support _optional_ {{TypeRef}}. This would (probably) require adding a _magic_ value to {{BuiltInType}} representing a "null" selection. It would need to:

- Appear at the top of the "Data Type selector" widget (with label "<None>" or similar)
- Be the _selected_ option when the {{TypeRef}} is the new _magic_ value (this should happen automatically, but worth checking!)
- The marshaller should set the {{TypeRef}} to the _magic_ {{BuiltInType}} if the DMN model (coming from XML->{{kie-dmn-model}}->workbench model) has a {{null}} {{TypeRef}} - the _magic_ value is only to be used _client-side_.
- The marshaller should set the {{TypeRef}} to {{null}} when converting from the workbench model to {{kie-dmn-model}} and the workbench model {{TypeRef}} is the _magic_ value - again, the _magic_ value is only to be used _client-side_.
- Check that creating new data-types does not show the _magic_ value (it uses a different widget, but population of the widget probably iterates all {{BuiltInType}}.

[~tari_manga] [~karreiro] seem reasonable to you?

[DMN Designer] QName: Default to be 'Any' not 'string' At the moment the _default_ {{QName}} is {{string}} however [~tirelli] has requested it be changed to {{Any}}. Please also note that the the _name_ for {{Any}} should be "*A*ny" and not "*a*ny" as we currently have. See:

https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-dmn/kie-wb-common-dmn-api/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/dmn/api/property/dmn/QName.java#L39

Rich Text assembly visual style / background image By default i.e. no visual styles applied, there is supposed to be a background image applied (via CSS) to the Rich Text assembly type. The image is `/themes/custom/rhdp/docs/img/white_diamond_background.png`. You can see the styles in `/themes/custom/rhdp/rhd-frontend/src/styles/assembly/_rich_text.scss`.

I discussed this with [~gdoyle], and she felt that, by default, no background image should be applied. A background image could be applied with a visual style however.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* All Rich Text assemblies currently using the 'No background' visual style should have that visual style removed
* The 'No background' visual style should be deleted

Nodes can share a single URL alias h3. Description

If an editor accidentally creates 2 nodes with the same URL aliases, it becomes impossible for them to access to node edit form of the node that was first assigned the URL alias AND there seems to be no way for an editor to revert their changes or otherwise undo this.

h3. Developer workaround

h5. Step 1 - Get the node id of the node(s) that shouldn't have the alias

Go here: https://developers.redhat.com/admin/structure/views/view/content 

* Add the Content: ID (ID) Views field to the View so that you can actually see/get the node id
* Scroll down to the preview and take note of the node IDs you need

h5. Step 2 - Remove the alias from those nodes

* Go to the URL aliases config page: https://developers.redhat.com/admin/config/search/path/filter
* Search for the alias and you should see the 2 (or more) aliases
* Remove the aliases for the nodes that shouldn't have the alias

h5. Step 3 - Add a new URL alias to these nodes

* Go to https://developers.redhat.com/[one-of-the-node-ids]/edit and update the URL alias field and persist the form

Modals can break if modal height extends beyond browser height h3. Description

Certain Drupal modals may become partially unusable by content creators / editors if the contents of the modal extend beyond the height of the modal and browser window and scrolling is not permitted.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* Compose somehow accounts for the contents of a modal such that all modals should be usable even if the contents for whatever reason extend beyond the expect height/width of a modal.
* The token browser modal specifically can be used/navigated by an editor

h3. Temporary workaround

* Add an overflow: scroll in the meantime to make the token browser usable (and the same goes for any other modals that might suffer from this issue)

Editors cannot view drafts using /node/[nid] route h3. Acceptance Criteria

* Editors can view drafts using the /node/[nid] route pattern
* Suspect: path-auto, probably not permission related, URL aliases

Reported by: [~mikgue]

Add Visual Style Field to Events Hero Currently the Events Hero has a default blue background so uses white text. 

When you change the background, you run into problems with legibility when using a lighter background.

Need to add the visual style field to this assembly. Based on visual styles for light/dark in others. Product Download assembly styles would be an example.
Article TOC is expanding in width with scroll After scrolling past the title of the article, the TOC is expanding in width when sticky so it pushes up onto the left side of the article body text.

Article TOC links need to change color on hover/selection/area Article TOC jump-to links should be changing color from original state #0066cc to #004c98 on hover state and once the reader is at that section. (https://developers.redhat.com/coderland/serverless/serverless-knative-intro/)

Example situation:
TOC has 3 sections: Intro, Middle, End
*Use case 1*: If the reader hovers over "Intro" in the TOC, the color should change from #0066cc to #004c98. When the reader selects "Intro" in the TOC, the scroll behavior will work as it currently does but "Intro" link on TOC will remain #004c98 upon selection.
*Use case 2*: When the reader scrolls to Intro within the article, the "Intro" link on the TOC color should change from #0066cc to #004c98.
*Use case 3*: When the reader scrolls to Middle within the article, the "Intro" link on the TOC should return to #0066cc and the "Middle" link on the TOC should change to #004c98.

Rich Text with Image Assembly should stack columns The rich text with image assembly does not stack columns on top of each other in responsive states currently. The text should be expanding to full-width and the columns should stack once the screen reaches Tablet Portrait.

Example: https://developers.redhat.com/topics/linux (Linux for Developers section)

Featured Resources Assembly grid responsive layout The grid layout for featured resources currently squishes each item so there are 2 per row at the smallest screen size. We want it to size down to 1 per row once screen size gets to Mobile Portrait.

Example: https://developers.redhat.com/index.php/topics/linux (Linux Tutorials and References section)

Light CTAs need a caret icon to the right of the text We need to add a right-caret icon to the right of text in Light CTAs. The color will still remain the same (#0066cc). The icon should be font awesome "caret-right" in size 16. This will apply across the site - mainly appears within rich text assemblies (seen on CodeReady Workspaces page).

URL alias required and content creators cannot set URL aliases Content Creators (users with only the Content Creator role) cannot successfully create nodes because the URL alias field is required but they do not have permission to set a URL alias.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* Content Creators can successfully create all node types without being blocked in any way by the URL alias field

Rollback search_api to 8.1.11 on 2 broken PRs h3. Description

After a quick look into this, it seems that there is some confusion within Drupal as to whether or not the search_api module is enabled. I will post a Slack comment that I made on Friday for context:

{quote}I am not sure how/why, but it seems that Drupal thinks the `search_api` module is installed (at least according to the `lightning_config` table's `core.extension`, which I would suspect should be the definitive 'truth' of whether or not a module is considered enabled/installed. However, the Drupal admin interface seems to think that the module is not installed, and the fact that the hook_update_N() cannot be found also suggests the module is likely not installed

I tried installing the module locally, which resulted in a fatal error that I can't seem to get around. I'll rebuild my environment and keep debugging.{quote}

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* In this ticket, the only deliverable will be to get the 2 broken PR builds to build cleanly by downgrading to search_api:8.1.11
* In DEVELOPER-5770, we will actually investigate _why_ search_api hook_update_8105() results in a fatal updb

Review User Roles and Documents Document user roles, permissions, automation, and who has what.

It seems very likely that this is somehow related to content moderation or a module in that family of modules
Fix download version on cdk In the link https://developers.redhat.com/products/cdk/download the big red download button links to cdk-3.7.0-2 instead of cdk-3.8.0-2
Spike test the Upgrade Wordpress developers blog to latest version (security flaw) Update to latest WordPress version and update all compatible plugins

Assembly: Title Field Style Doesn't Match in Rich Text Assembly The Title field style is different in the Rich Text Assembly from other assemblies.  They need to match and have the same header style. Correct title style found in Rich text with image and collection assembly (and the rest).

Screenshot attached to show difference.

Disqus calls being made for off-site content  There are currently issues with Disqus calls being made for content that is not on the developers site. One example is the "Around Red Hat" section on the home page. The issue is that DIsqus will throw an error because these sites are not allowed under our account. This makes each load of pages that contain this type of content throw multiple script errors and could have a detrimental effect on SEO as well as page load.

Assembly: Fix responsive behavior of Collection Assembly Currently when viewing the collection assembly in tablet mode, the content article titles are not ideal during the transition from tablet to mobile. They retain the 4 across tile layout when it SHOULD smoothly transition from 4-3-2 across layouts, depending on window size.

Current implementation screenshot attached.

Assembly: Fix responsive behavior of Rich Text Columns Currently when you are in tablet mode, the rich text column assembly is not ideal. Instead of retaining the 3 columns side by side in this mode, it should switch to stacking the content from each column into rows.

Screenshot attached of current state.

Improve UX for Product content type between new & deprecated fields h3. Description

Currently, there is little visual distinction between the 'old' product page fields and the 'new', assembly-based product page fields on the node edit form. I did my best to group the new product page, assembly based fields using a fieldgroup in such a way that I had hoped would provide a visual distinction, however it seems that isn't as obvious as I had assumed.

+*Approval on Staging Composer branch to flow out when it is released.*+

Mike has suggested we try using a background color to make the visual distinction between the fields more clear.

We need to either split these into different content types or make a clear visual distinction between 'old' product page section and 'new' product page section on Product node edit form 

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* Determine if a background color is 1) feasible and 2) the best way to visual distinguish between these 2 groups of fields
* Include Mike (and other editors if necessary) in the conversation to get feedback on their experience
* Implement whatever is decided to be the best editor UX

The module lightning does not exist {code}Drupal\Core\Extension\Exception\UnknownExtensionException: The module lightning does not exist. in Drupal\Core\Extension\ExtensionList->get() (line 257 of /var/www/drupal/web/core/lib/Drupal/Core/Extension/ExtensionList.php).{code}

Sitemap broken/inaccurate for new product pages We are hooking into the simple sitemap module to provide custom routes due to the custom nature of the routing of our product pages. However, in our recent product experience epic, it was decided that the routing of the product pages should change slightly. Now the sitemap is not reflecting these changes, but instead it still displays the routes generated from the Paragraphs referenced from the Product pages.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* If a product is using the new design, it should generate these sitemap routes using the reference assemblies NOT the referenced paragraphs
* Product pages using the old design should still generate sitemap entries using the paragraph references

New Product Pages created in a Draft state can be accessed by anonymous users h2. Description

New Product Pages created in a Draft state can be accessed by anonymous users.

h2. Steps to recreate

* Create a new Product node (/node/add/product)
* Use a fake value for Product Code and URL Product Name
* Fill in any required fields
* Within the NEW PRODUCT PAGE FIELDS fieldset
** Check the Use New Product Page checkbox
** Add at least 1 assembly to each of the 3 assembly fields: Content, Downloads Page Content and Getting Started Page Content
* Publish the page in a Draft state

You should notice:

* If you access the page you just created in an anonymous/incognito window, you can still see the Draft version of the Product node

h2. Stakeholders

* ENG: [~lightguard] [~jordan.white]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* A draft product page should not be displayed at any point until it is published.

h2. Review steps

* Create a draft product page and ensure that it is not possible to visit this page as an anonymous user and the product page does not appear in {{sitemap.xml}}

It is possible to create two product pages with the same `URL Product Name` value h2. Requirements

We have a problem with the export this morning where a Test page has claimed the URL for a full product page. It appears that the test page is also using the {{`openjdk`}} URL Product Name field. It should not be possible to create or copy a Product Content type and end-up with two products using the same value for this field.

h2. Stakeholders

* ENG - [~jordan.white], [~lightguard]
* BUSINESS - [~paul.robinson]

h2. Acceptance Criteria:

* It should not be possible to create a Product Page using a {{URL Product Name}} value that is already in use
* If I copy/duplicate a Product page, I am forced to alter the {{URL Product Name}} value before it can be saved

h2. Review Steps

* Create a product page using a {{URL Product Name}} that is already in use and see that you cannot do that
* Copy/duplicate a product page and see that you're forced to change the {{URL Product Name}} value before it can be saved.

Fix unit-test build issues Summary:
Since the project was cleaned up, and unit tests were moved to the drupal web-root, the unit-tests have been sending the incorrect test status to Github for PR's. There is also another issue with the HTML that karma generates is not being created inside the docker container, therefore it is not viewable from PR's.

This is a major issue, as even if unit-tests are failing the PR will always state that the tests are passing.

Expected:
- PR receives the correct PR status
- HTML report is generated and is linked to PR's.

Ebook download UX Improvements. I wanted to capture a few observations on the ebook download UX (given that ebooks are being promoted fairly heavily).

(The download seemed to get hung up on me twice, no clues what was going on.  Reloading the page cured that.)

* The PDF isn't recognized by the desktop browser as a PDF so it doesn't open automatically.  On desktop (Windows) you are just prompted to save the file. I don't know if the file is presenting as a generic mime type (octet stream) because of download manager requirements, but I think the UX would be improved if the PDF had the right mime type so the browser could do the right thing.  
* The download immediately fails with no error on iOS.  Clicking the direct link works to open the PDF and then the right thing happens.  This might be related to the above.  (Maybe it's just me, but I think downloading the pdf for reading on a mobile device might not be an uncommon use case.)
* The text on the download page needs to be improved, on desktop it says: "Thank you for downloading the: Microservices for Java devs".  This seems a bit awkward.   The iOS version is "Thank you for downloading the: Media:+Microservices+for+Java+devs".  See screen shots.

Blog – Command line presentation update fixes h2. Requirements
Some of the code presentation samples are running over the preformatted (<pre>) block quotes due to the sample command lines being quite long. It's been suggested that we convert these to the [code]/Syntax Highlighter presentations but [~rterzi] points out that this method can lead to incorrect character presentations. With this being the case, the <pre> block CSS needs to be adjusted to allow for length lines of code, whether it be through white space wrapping, adding horizontal scrolling to <pre>'s or possibly devising some other presentation container.

Example Post: https://developers.redhat.com/blog/2018/08/29/intro-to-podman/

h2. Design
* N/A

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG
* UX

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* We can verify that we have a suitable presentation for  code syntax that satisfies UX/Design needs and that does not present characters incorrectly or otherwise mangle code samples.

h2. Review Steps
* Preview any post in stage with the revised code syntax example.

RHD Blog Pre blocks not in monospaced font. h2. Requirements
RHD Blog <pre> blocks are showing up in a variable spaced overpass font instead of a monospaced font.  This causes things like indentation to not line up.  <pre> and any code/listing blocks should always be monospaced.   Indentation is important and is critical for some languages as it is part of the syntax.

See https://developers.redhat.com/blog/2018/06/26/data-grid-multi-cloud-real-time-game/ 

This issue was in the main site: [DEVELOPER-5089]

h2. Design
* N/A

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* <pre> blocks show a monospace font in stage and production
* A new post is created in stage to allow testing of <pre> and other types of syntax/text formats.

h2. Review Steps
* Verify that <pre> is monospace
* Preview stage test post.

Some links in production point to http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com domain h2. Requirements
Some links in production point to the http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com domain, when they should link to the production site URL.

Eg. page https://developers.redhat.com/quickstarts/eap/bean-validation/ has 'Target Product: Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform' which points to http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com/node/33895

These all need finding and fixing.

h2. Tasks
* Take a dump of the production website. 
* Search for all occurrences of {{rhdp-drupal.redhat.com}}.
* Find fixes for all occurrences. If there are many, it might be quicker to use a database migration script to batch fix the content.

It would also be good to understand how these broken URLs crept in.

h2. Review Steps
* Take a dump of the PR website. 
* Search for all occurrences of {rhdp-drupal.redhat.com} and check there are none.
* Apply the same test on production once live.

WP/RHD Blog New Site CSS issues h2. Requirements
There seem to be issues with the CSS styling for Wordpress since the RHD site redesign, some issues have been addressed but possibly not correctly.  The definition of "done" for this is 2-3 parts
1. fix the obvious problems
2. Ensure that the RHD Blog/Wordpress uses consistent styling with the rest of the site.
3. Make sure the styling for text, including technical content, is reasonable on the main site.

Known issues:
1. The styling for links seems to be done incorrectly, a small font size keeps getting used for links that winds up being incorrect depending on what type of elements the link appears in.
   * last week the small font was fixed for links that appear inside of list elements.
   * But now I see that a link that appears in an H3 has a different/tiny font compared to the H3.

2. Bold vs. normal is hard to see in regular text.
3. The normal font size for blog text seems quite large compared to the rest of the site.



h2. Design
* N/A

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* Formatting is matched between the RHD Site and RHD Blog

h2. Review Steps
* Compare RHD Site Header and Footer between RHD Site and RHD Blog in identically-sized browser windows (Chrome and Firefox)

registration and login broken and logged in without being asked for password Today I went and registered a new account for testing purposes and the flow was really weird and borked.

1. go to openshift.io
2. click signup
3. enter data in developers.redhat.com (used manderse+gluster@redhat.com as email)
4. get to screen abuot getting email to verify
5. verify in email
6. goto developers.redhat.com in same tab as #4 and try and click login and nothing happens. I do it several times.
   various errors in log (see attachement)
7. I click login a few more times and then open new tab..click login - Magic - now i get page asking to verify user info ...note I have NOT been asked for password. That can't be right.

thus in short - login button broken and when reload i'm logged in without being asked for password and shown my personal details.

after updating email the auth/login flow results in "You are already logged in dead-end" I had by accident used manderse+review@redhat.com instead of manderse+preview@redhat.com on my test account.

On first login after that to https://manage.openshift.com/openshiftio?cluster=starter-us-east-2a I end up not being asked at all who I am, and be told to verify my email.

Blog search fails (when not logged into to wordpress) Searching the RHD blog via the search box on blog pages fails.  The URL changes to include the search parameter, but the top level page is returned as if the search parameter was being ignored.

The search results page is being returned quickly as no search was performed and the page is being returned out of cache.

EDIT: I believe the problem is the cache is ignoring the presence of URL parameters when making decisions about what is cacheable and whether to return a page out of cache or send it on to the wordpress server.

-At times, searches appears to work correctly if you are logged into wordpress. - 

It is possible this is related to other wordpress caching problems mentioned in [RHDENG-1909].

"Bad Request" when attempting to download PDFs from the download manager h2. To Reproduce

# Make sure you are logged out of the RHDP website
#  Visit https://developers.redhat.com/promotions/building-reactive-microservices-in-java/ or https://developers.redhat.com/promotions/migrating-to-microservice-databases/
# Select "DOWNLOAD PDF"
# Login (if you don't see the login screen, you probably didn't log out correctly). I used LinkedIn social login.
# Observe: https://www.dropbox.com/s/n09efieoz7981b4/Screenshot%202017-10-16%2009.00.49.png?dl=0
# Observe: URL looks something like: https://developers.redhat.com/download-manager/rest/keycloak?state=7b967be9-7d49-471d-93e2-c74dbb78f177&code=j7bwnYx-ySrO5FZ7UEDG2ZuhcSBSpxcvDzIr84I6BNQ.1670df58-fd13-434a-ab82-d69e9a60fb1d#!

h2. Probable root cause
The problem seems to be caused by PDF links (on the download manager) being opened in a new tab. There seems to be some JS that become uninitialised when this happens. I think the fix is to prevent any links to files on the download manager from being opened in a new tab.

* The JDG product download from /downloads worked correctly.
* "Migrating to Microservice Databases" was last updated (in the download manager) on Tue Oct 10 11:39:27 EDT 2017 by dcoughlin1. This download has worked correctly since then, so it seems to not be caused by a config issue in the download manager.

Rsync to staging and production file system locations fails as it tries to delete .snapshot directories The filesystem locations on filemgmt.jboss.org used for production and staging are backed up and hence contain a .snapshot directory.

The rsync command we use to rsync to these directories passes the {{--delete}} option and will therefore try to delete anything on the receiving side that is not present on the sending side. As the {{.snapshot}} directories are only on the receiving side, it tries to delete the directory, but this fails, causing the entire rsync process to fail.

The {{.snapshot}} directory should always be excluded from the rsync process.

*Definition of Done*

* It is possible to rsync to the production and staging locations on filemgmt.jboss.org

Content fetched from DCP will always show the final_base_url in Drupal and not the local environment base_url  When we push content into Drupal using Awestruct, we use two different parameters to determine the URLs that are generated for the site. These parameters are:

* {{base_url}}: The environment specific URL of the site e.g. in the case of production Drupal: http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com/
* {{final_base_url}}: The final URL of the site when is has been exported and is publicly available e.g. http://developers.redhat.com

When pushing content into the DCP as part of the Awestruct process, we must use the {{final_base_url}} value otherwise resources and other latest content will point to a URL that does not resolve to visitors of the publicly available site. This has the downside that when visiting the Drupal instance, you will always be directed to the public version of the site when clicking on a resource or latest content link because it too is using the {{final_base_url}} value.

It may be desirable for content to be linked relative to whatever environment it is running in rather than absolutely using {{final_base_url}}

*Definition of Done*

* It is possible to have content retrieved from the DCP linked relatively no matter which environment it is viewed in

Export fails because Drupal cron is already executing By default, Drupal 8 configures itself to execute cron every 3 hours. A problem arises if we try to run an export whilst cron is running as part of this schedule.

As part of the export process we invoke cron on Drupal to ensure that the sitemap.xml is up-to-date with all pages. If cron is already executing, then this part of the process fails.

*Definition of Done*

* Disable automatic execution of cron on Drupal instance by default

Incorrect base URL is sent to Searchisko when running Awestruct against Drupal We use the site.base_url to set the base URL of the site. When using Drupal, this is set to the hostname of the VM not the final destination. For example in production, the base_url is set to:

http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com/

and not 

http://developers.redhat.com

The reason for this is so that the content loads correctly when viewing Drupal. The export process rewrites the links to be relative so that it works correctly when delivered via developers.redhat.com.

The problem with the above is that we send the incorrect base_url into searchikso. For searchisko, we need to send developers.redhat.com and not developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com.

*Definition of Done*

* The correct URL is sent to searchisko given the final destination of the site once

Login/Logout is not working on export of site from Drupal The login and logout links are always present on the exported version of the site from Drupal. Clicking on either does nothing.

*Definition of Done*

* Login and logout links work as expected
* Either login or logout is shown depending upon whether or not the user is currently logged into the site.

Not all links appear to be re-written in export of site from Drupal Browsing around an export of the site from Drupal, it would appear that not all links get re-written properly. Two examples that I have found just by browsing the front-page:

* Technologies -> Red Hat Developer Toolset still points to the Drupal instance
* Developers Salary Survey still points to the Drupal instance

My first guess as to why this is happening is that the links in the page are suffixed with a "/" whereas in the sitemap.xml there is no trailing "/". I suspect that Httack sees the trailing slash and determines that the page is trying to link to a directory rather than another page, sees that it doesn't have that directory in its fetch list and hence leaves it as is.

It is worth noting that the content has been exported OK e.g. the .html file exists where you expect it to.

*Definition of Done*

Bind mount of _docker/drupal into Drupal container causes deployment issues h3. Problem

Currently we bind mount _docker/drupal into the Drupal container via this definition in the docker-compose.yml for each environment:

{code}
drupal:
    ...
    volumes:
      - ../../drupal:/var/www/drupal
{code}

Essentially this means that Drupal is using part of the Git checkout as its workspace. This is causing several problems when I'm trying to get the pull request job to work:

# Because the Drupal container is running as user root, any files or folders touched by the root user cannot be deleted by the Jenkins slave with a subsequent job runs. This causes any subsequent job to fail, meaning that we need to be very vigilant to make sure this does not happen. As a work-around, I have managed to synchronise the apache user id and jenkins_developer id to ensure file ownership permissions are correct.
# As a side-effect of the above, when developing on your local machine and running the Drupal instance, if you do not have the same id as the jenkins_developer (1000), parts of your Git repository suddenly become unreadable/unwritable. The only current solution is to 'chown' the repository back to something that works for you. This would suggest that we need to allow the user to parameterise the uid of the apache user based upon their environment, or list it as a known problem
# It is not possible to run a "retest this please" or re-run a build where Drupal is already running because of the bind mounted '/var/www/drupal/web/images' and '/var/www/drupal/web/fonts'. When Jenkins tries to reset the workspace to re-run the job, it cannot remove these directories as they are in use by the drupal container. The only way around this would be to add a pre-checkout step to all Jenkins builds that stops all containers first. 

Given the above, my feeling is that using the `_docker/drupal` directory as a bind mount that is written to by the Drupal container is not the correct way to be doing things and is going to cause us more problems in the future.

h3. Potential Solution

My initial thought is that an alternative approach is to 'COPY' the _drupal directory into the Drupal container at build time. This means that the Drupal container can happily write to this file-system without impacting upon the Git repository checkout. This should resolve all file system permission issues above and also prevent us from having to configure pre-checkout build steps to stop any containers. So this would mean a change to the Dockerfile for the Drupal container to include something like:

{code}
COPY . /var/www/
{code}

A down-side I can see to this is that each time you run the container, you have to wait for composer to install again. I don't immediately have a solution for this, but I think we may just have to roll with that. 

Secondly we have to now explicitly bind mount in the rhd.settings.php and rhd.settings.yml files as the main drupal filesystem is no longer bind-mounted. So the docker-compose.yml would end up looking something like:

{code}
drupal:
    build: ../../drupal
    ports:
      - "80"
    links:
      - drupalmysql
      - searchisko
    volumes:
      - ./rhd.settings.php:/var/www/drupal/web/sites/default/rhd.settings.php
      - ./rhd.settings.yml:/var/www/drupal/web/sites/default/rhd.settings.yml
      - ../../../images:/var/www/drupal/web/images
      - ../../../stylesheets/fonts:/var/www/drupal/web/fonts
{code}

The rhd.settings.php and rhd.settings.yml files would need to exist before the container starts otherwise the bind-mount will fail. This is not a problem for the drupal-dev, drupal-staging and drupal-production environments as these files willl contain only known values and therefore don't need to be templated.

However for the drupal-pull-request environment, the rhd.settings.yml file needs to be templated, so the templating process needs to be split into 2:

# Create the rhd.settings.yml file before starting the container so the bind mount will work
# As soon as the container has booted, template the contents of the rhd.settings.yml file with the correct endpoints

Document proposed Drupal Architecture In order to communicate our ideas to Phase2 we need to produce a document that they can read prior to our initial meeting at the beginning of May.

The document should contain:

1. A diagram showing the eventual Drupal Architecture.
2. An explanation of the key pieces in the diagram

In particular it should cover:

1. How content is automatically added. This covers things like Video and Quickstart pages.
2. Which pieces of the architecture live on the VPN and which off the VPN (and thus publicly exposed)
3. How content is exported. E.g the static content to the production Apache server
4. Where testing occurs
5. How content is created and modified by content editors
6. The content workflow starting from the template and ending with an editable content type.

* The document has been reviewed and approved by [~lightguard], [~lincolnthree], [~ihamilto] and [~rblake].

[RH-SSO 7.2] [RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD] Split os-sso module into version specific RH-SSO and common RH-SSO modules The RH-SSO 7.2 for OpenShift and RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD for OpenShift images utilize _os-sso72_ and  _sso.config.launch.setup_ (former _os-sso73_) module, respectively:
* [RH-SSO 7.2 version|https://github.com/jboss-openshift/cct_module/tree/master/os-sso72], 
* [RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD version|https://github.com/jboss-container-images/redhat-sso-7-openshift-image/tree/sso-cd-dev/modules/sso/config/launch/setup/73] which currently combines both:
* The part necessary for configuration and launch of some specific version of the RH-SSO product (e.g. _standalone-openshift.xml_ and _openshift-launch.sh_ scripts), with
* The part common to all RH-SSO images -- not changing when the version of the underlying RH-SSO product changes (e.g. _import-realm.json_, _index.html_ files, or majority of the files located under _launch_ subdirectory).

_Acceptance Criteria:_
The change should split current _os-sso72_ module into two separate modules as follows:
* Keep the common (not changing across RH-SSO versions) part under _os-sso-common_ module, and
* Place the RH-SSO version specific (changing part) into _sso.config.launch.setup_ RH-SSO module.

This way the code duplicity (currently present) will be eliminated -- if there's a bug common to all RH-SSO images, it will be enough to correct it in _os-sso-common_ module (and not in each RH-SSO image version).

[RH-SSO 7.2] [RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD] Consume standalone-openshift.xml from upstream standalone-ha.xml The RH-SSO 7.2 for OpenShift and RH-SSO 7.3 CD Technology Preview for OpenShift images currently keep own, fixed-form copy of _standalone-openshift.xml_ configuration file:
* [RH-SSO 7.2 copy|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jboss-openshift/cct_module/master/os-sso72/added/standalone-openshift.xml]
* [RH-SSO 7.3 copy|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jboss-container-images/redhat-sso-7-openshift-image/sso-cd-dev/modules/sso/config/launch/setup/73/added/standalone-openshift.xml]

Since such fixed copy gets outdated very quickly, it leads to issues when outdated _standalone-openshift.xml_ configuration file fails to launch with most recent Keycloak server overlay Zip archive.

_Acceptance Criteria:_
The change should introduce new _sso.create.configuration_ module (the _/72_ and _/73_ variants of it, respectively), basically doing two things:
# Retrieving latest version of _standalone-ha.xml_ from upstream for specific RH-SSO product version,
# Modifying such _standalone-ha.xml_ into form expected by _standalone-openshift.xml_:
 ## This includes introduction of "XML anchors" like {noformat}<!-- ##SSL## -->{noformat}, or {noformat}<!-- ##MGMT_IFACE_REALM## -->{noformat} (see above links to existing copies to get the finite list of all these required anchors),
  ## And transformation of _standalone-ha.xml_ to _standalone-openshift.xml_ by adding parts, necessary on OpenShift platform (e.g. OpenShift log formatter etc.)

Corrections needed information about Controller and OpenShiftStartup strategies in operator docs  [~filippe.spolti] has found some statements in teh template docs such as:

"In some authoring environments, you might need to ensure that several users can deploy services on the same KIE Server at the same time. By default, after deploying a service onto a KIE Server using Business Central, the user needs to wait for some seconds before more services can be deployed. To remove this limitation, you can configure the environment to use the controller strategy. Do not make this change unless a specific need for it exists; if you decide to enable controller strategy, make this change on Business Central and on all KIE Servers in the same environment."

"To enable controller strategy on a KIE Server, set the KIE_SERVER_STARTUP_STRATEGY environment variable to ControllerBasedStartupStrategy."

These statements are outdated. Controller strategy is enabled on single authoring and must not be enabled on HA authoring (or KIE server control fails). There is no more need for switching a server to the controller strategy at all.

I need to find and remove all such statements; moreover this also needs to be done for 7.8 and possibly 7.7 docs.

[~vidya_iyengar] I am requesting inclusion in this sprint, because I want to hand template docs over for QA at the end of the week or early next week.

Missing information regarding kie server configuration when used with smart router in "Installing and configuring Red Hat Process Automation Manager in a Red Hat JBoss EAP clustered environment" Currently, in the chapter -[ 3.4 Clustering Process Servers with Smart Router|https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_process_automation_manager/7.5/html-single/installing_and_configuring_red_hat_process_automation_manager_in_a_red_hat_jboss_eap_clustered_environment/index#clustering-smartrouter-install-proc] we did not specify that kie servers should be unmanaged (not managed by controller/Business Central). BC HA on-prem setup does not include shared storage for Maven repository The current documentation includes setting up one NFS share. 

In the BC node setup procedure at https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_process_automation_manager/7.5/html/installing_and_configuring_red_hat_process_automation_manager_in_a_red_hat_jboss_eap_clustered_environment/clustering-dev-con#clustering-bc-configure-standalone_proc:

- In step 1 the share is mounted as /data

- In step 3 the value of org.uberfire.nio.git.dir is set to /data

This creates shared storage for the niogit repository.

However, Business Central also includes a built-in Maven repository. In the default setup the BC pushes KJARs to this repository and then the KIE server pulls the KJARs to deploy them.

In the present process, there is no shared storage for the Maven repository. This means every KJAR will just get pushed on the one node that happens to be handling the "build and deploy" operation. If the KIE server happens to connect to another node, it will not be able to pull the KJAR. To the user, this wiill probably look like "deployment failing randomly"/

The process must be modified to include setting up shared storage for the Maven repository either on the same NFS share or on a different NFS share. This is a documentation bug because the process is in the documentation; however, it reqires dev research first to work out the correct process.

[~adriel.paredes] - please work out the process.

Errors in Getting started with decision services In the "Getting started with decision services" document ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/index ) I found the following errors:

* In "2.4. Defining the traffic violations DMN decision logic" ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/dmn-con_decision-service-getting-started#dmn-gs-defining-decision-logic-proc ) at point 17. there's a missing 'then', so it should say

17. In the parameter cell below Driver.Points + Fine.Points, enter if Total Points >= 20 *then* "Yes" else "No". 

* In "3.1. Testing the traffic violations using test scenarios" ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/test-scenarios-intro-con#dmn-gs-testing-test-scenario-proc ) at point 7. both Speed Limit: and Actual Speed: should say "leave blank" instead of "-"

* In "4.1. Executing a DMN service using the Decision Server REST API" ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/dmn-execution-con#dmn-execution-rest-proc ) all the example requests are wrong: the name of the artifact is "traffic-violation" all in lower case so also all urls in the curl commands should use the same name in lower case. E.g.:

curl -u wbadmin:wbadmin -H "accept: application/xml" -X GET "http://localhost:8080/kie-server/services/rest/server/containers/Traffic-Violation_1.0.0/dmn"

should be

curl -u wbadmin:wbadmin -H "accept: application/xml" -X GET "http://localhost:8080/kie-server/services/rest/server/containers/traffic-violation_1.0.0/dmn"

Disable jBPM capability in Realtime Decision Server for BRMS installation In BRMS, jBPM capability of kie-server has to be disabled. It means that users have to set these system properties

{noformat}
org.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true
org.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true
{noformat}

It is automatically configured by BRMS installer or overwritten by EAP deployable. But in other cases, users have to do it manually so need to update our installer guide.

h3. JWS/Tomcat

* 2.7. Installing Red Hat JBoss BRMS on Red Hat JBoss Web Server
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_brms/6.4/single/installation_guide/index#installing_jboss_brms_on_jboss_ews_2

AS IS:
~~~
14. Define the btm.root system property and location where Bitronix configuration file is placed in: 

...

CATALINA_OPTS="-Xmx512M -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=$CATALINA_HOME/webapps/business-central/WEB-INF/classes/login.config -Dbtm.root=$CATALINA_HOME -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=$CATALINA_HOME/conf/btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry -Dorg.jboss.logging.provider=jdk"

...

Important

On Microsoft Windows systems...

set "CATALINA_OPTS=-Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=C:\apache-tomcat\webapps\business-central\WEB-INF\classes\login.config -Dbtm.root=C:\apache-tomcat -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=C:\apache-tomcat\conf\btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry"
~~~

TO BE:
~~~
14. Define the btm.root system property and location where Bitronix configuration file is placed in: 

...

CATALINA_OPTS="-Xmx512M -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=$CATALINA_HOME/webapps/business-central/WEB-INF/classes/login.config -Dbtm.root=$CATALINA_HOME -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=$CATALINA_HOME/conf/btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry -Dorg.jboss.logging.provider=jdk -Dorg.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true -Dorg.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true"

...

Important

On Microsoft Windows systems...

set "CATALINA_OPTS=-Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=C:\apache-tomcat\webapps\business-central\WEB-INF\classes\login.config -Dbtm.root=C:\apache-tomcat -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=C:\apache-tomcat\conf\btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry -Dorg.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true -Dorg.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true"
~~~


h3. WebSphere

* 3.7. Adding Custom JVM Properties
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_brms/6.4/single/ibm_websphere_installation_and_configuration_guide/index#add_custom_jvm_properties

Add these properties to "Table 3.4. Properties Required for Realtime Decision Server"

~~~
Name : org.jbpm.server.ext.disabled
Value : true
Description : When set to true, disables the BPM support (for example, processes support). Must be disabled for BRMS.

Name : org.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled
Value : true
Description : When set to true, disables the Intelligent Process Server UI extension. Must be disabled for BRMS.
~~~

h3. WebLogic

* 3.1. Setting Environment Variables
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_brms/6.4/single/oracle_weblogic_installation_and_configuration_guide/index#setting_environment_variables

Add 2 entries to "Properties Required for Realtime Decision Server"

- org.jbpm.server.ext.disabled: When set to true, disables the BPM support (for example, processes support). Set to true
- org.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled: When set to true, disables the Intelligent Process Server UI extension. Set to true

Also change " Set the following custom properties in a single environment variable:"

AS IS:
~~~
JAVA_OPTIONS="-Dkie.server.jms.queues.response=jms/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE
 -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=ruleflow
 -Dorg.uberfire.start.method=ejb
 -Dorg.uberfire.domain=OracleDefaultLoginConfiguration
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.cf=jms/cf/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.queue=jms/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dcom.sun.jersey.server.impl.cdi.lookupExtensionInBeanManager=true"
~~~

TO BE:
~~~
JAVA_OPTIONS="-Dkie.server.jms.queues.response=jms/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE
 -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=ruleflow
 -Dorg.uberfire.start.method=ejb
 -Dorg.uberfire.domain=OracleDefaultLoginConfiguration
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.cf=jms/cf/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.queue=jms/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dcom.sun.jersey.server.impl.cdi.lookupExtensionInBeanManager=true
 -Dorg.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true
 -Dorg.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true"
~~~

New Fact Field Value Columns* of [section|http://ccs-jenkins.gsslab.brq.redhat.com:8080/view/Topic%20branches%20-%20BRMS/job/doc-BRMS-User_Guide-branch-7.0-la-preview/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/index.html#sect_column_types] should be merged with the *7.4.6.4. Field Value Columns* sub section because there are no more two separate options for setting field of an existing fact and a new fact. Attaching also some procedure:

- Invoke new column wizard - link the section 7.4.5. Adding Columns
- Select *Set the value of a field* option
- Click Next
- Select either existing pattern (select box) or create new one (button)
- Click next
- Select field that you would like to update
- Click next
- Provide list of acceptable values and default value, both optional
- Click next
- Provide column header, hide column - optional, according to your data in second page of wizard you can *update engine with changes* or *insert fact logically*
- Finish the wizard

Imported projects have wrong config on Git repository config This is the correct format for "origin" config:

[remote "origin"]
	url = https://github.com/porcelli/NewSampleGH.git
	fetch = +refs/heads/:refs/remotes/origin/

But this is how we get when Importing:

[remote "origin"]
	url = https://github.com/porcelli/SampleTest.git
	fetch = +refs/:refs/
	mirror = true

Notice that we need remove the mirror and change the fetch to have the correct format.

* The content itself (both text and charts) is not resized to fit the screen.

Maven compiler uses undesired system properties  Maven compiler is not ignoring system properties, set on users machine, that can break its build.

List of properties that should be ignored or set to default, when compiling project using our maven compiler
* "maven.main.skip" - Skips compliation of sources (maven property)

// will be updated with more properties, if we manage to identify more of these

Basically right now users can setup system properties, and these properties will be used in maven compiler.

Git repository not accessible due to "Unable to complete your request, The following exception occurred: null" When you try to open any asset in a given repository, this ends with

"Unable to complete your request, The following exception occurred: null"

It makes the whole repository inaccessible, and the only current remedy we have is this:

$ git clone system.git/
$  cd system
$ git branch -a // find out the user's branch
$ git push origin --delete <USER_BRANCH>

This error only happens for a specific user - if you log into different user, you can access the same resources without any errors.

Unfortunately, we do not have a consistent way of reproducing.
Let us know what could help in investigation.

Workbench Rest API - deleting space sometimes randomly takes more than 10-30 seconds There is a couple of integration tests in [kie-wb-distributions|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions/tree/master/kie-wb-tests/kie-wb-tests-rest/src/test/java/org/kie/wb/test/rest/functional] that test workbench rest api (managing projects, spaced, maven build etc.).

These have been failing very often as described in [this PR|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions/pull/778]. For example failure see [this|http://janhrcek.cz/random-failures/#/class/org.kie.wb.test.rest.functional.ProjectIntegrationTest/method/org.kie.wb.test.rest.functional.ProjectIntegrationTest].

We found that they're failing in the step when spaces are deleted in `@AfterClass` - quite often it takes more than 10 seconds to delete the space and the client request times out. This seems to be happening randomly no matter the size of space being deleted (even space with just 1 empty project).

For now I increased client timeout to 30 seconds, so that these tests don't fail so often.

TODO the goal of this task is to find the root cause of the slowness. To make the investigation easier I create an `@Ignore`-d test in the PR above which, when disabled, clearly demonstrates this behavior.
JGit Filesystem cache improvements Develop personalized cache mechanism for our file system.

Import project should not follow examples workflow (title and repository name) Currently, the import project process uses the same flow as the import examples, which leads to some inconsistencies, like: screen title, internal repositories names. This should be fixed.
Goal of this task is to patch these problems.
New project screen doesn’t block the create project button while is loading The create project button should be disabled after it was clicked to avoid the creation of multiple projects.

[IE] Project Explorer disappears after editing pom.xml file When you change something in pom.xml file and then switch the view of Project Explorer to "Project View", Project Explorer disappears and you are redirected to the asset list.

After deleting a project an error modal shows in Library Screen.
Error text: Unable to complete your request. The following exception occurred: 'd' is null.
There is no stack.

*How to reproduce it:*
* Create a Project.
* Delete the project.
* Error should pop up.

Angular UI executes requests twice when transitioning from one UI tab to another  We do have a problem on UPS Angular UI:
* clicking on the navigation TAB does trigger HTTP request twice, when moving from one page/view to a different one.

Clicking on the same tab (and no transition happens), we get the requests for that view only once.


I also think some weird page-reload is happening.... 

clicking on the current TAB, and not navigting... all is good; request only once :-)

So attempt to fix it:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unifiedpush-server/pull/784

but it's still there...

Charset related CocoaPods problem in Digger OSX h3. What
{code}
 export LANG=en_US.UTF-8
{code}
Line above should be added to Bash profile in OSX nodes. I've seen this problem locally and also in OSM4.

Although the warning below says we should have that line in {{~/.profile}}, I had local success when I put that line in my {{~/.bashrc}} file.

We should do it in digger-installer Ansible role.

h3. Why

CocoaPods fails to install pods for project : https://github.com/feedhenry-templates/helloworld-ios-swift
Perhaps there is a file with a different encoding somewhere.

I've googled and saw that having {{export LANG=en_US.UTF-8}} is recommended.

Configure macOS node in Jenkins using Ansible Currently we have the macOS for the buildfarm being configured. However, we need this machine to be automatically configured with Jenkins. This includes adding env vars to the node in Jenkins:
* BASH
* CI
* MY_RUBY_HOME
* GEM_HOME
* NVM_PREFFIX
* PATH

Document macOS prerequisites and setup We need to document the hosts which the macOS node needs access to in order to provision successfully. These are:
* https://github.com
* https://raw.githubusercontent.com
* https://rvm.io

The following steps for setting up the Jenkins node should also be documented in case the user decides they don't want it auto-configured. These are documented in https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AGDIGGER-119

A lot of the content needed for this can be found in https://github.com/aerogear/digger-installer/tree/master/provision-osx . The task should mostly be cleaning it up and moving it to where we decide the documentation should go.

add tests to android_pvc_check in nagios Following on from the linked JIRA there are some tests that need to be added for the android_pvc check. I have these mostly completed so opening this JIRA as a tracker.

Fix issues with Nagios check for macos node in buildfarm h4. What

Currently, the Nagios container within a Buildfarm 2.0 project attempts to check the health status of a macOS slave via Jenkins. There are some issues with the check in its current state. 

Firstly, it appears to assume https and when using a self signed certificate, the check will fail. [~pyates] hit this when testing on core team cluster which uses self signed cert. This is likely the case if Jenkins has been configured to use a http route also

Secondly, the container currently requires a jenkins username and password to be set as environment variables. This is fine if using the standard login, but this wont work when Jenkins is using oauth tokens for login

ping [~lfitzgerald] I think we should look at prioritising this issue

MacOS slave credential generation is not resilient to inventory changes *What:* Refactor/fix code for credentials generation\[1]. Current implementation is not resilient to inventory changes when multiple macos slaves are used. 

*Why:* E.g: if first entry of macos group in inventory file changes, credentials on some nodes might not be updated. That will eventually result in inability to reconnect to slave.

\[1] https://github.com/aerogear/digger-installer/blob/cb823f41b61b46a60361c1ba549e159e87d9b20b/provision-osx/tasks/configure_buildfarm_node.yml#L6-L41

"/bin/sh -c" is set by default when configuring Android slave pod "Command to run slave agent" is set to "/bin/sh -c" by default by Jenkins Kubernetes plugin : https://github.com/jenkinsci/kubernetes-plugin/blob/5d3a949c7cc5ffd1951b0a23631d64ffc5a1858a/src/main/java/org/csanchez/jenkins/plugins/kubernetes/PodTemplate.java#L146

Missing dependency on expect module h4. What

With changes made in [https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AGDIGGER-229|AGDIGGER-229] to allow the user to use an ssh key with a password, an additional dependency on the python module "pexpect" was introduced.

We should automate the installation of this dependency if required.

h4. Why

This is not installed during the process if it is missing and the result being the playbook fails.

h4. How
Ideally we would install this using Ansibles yum module. However the rpm provides a version lower than that required by Ansible so as of now there are two solutions.

1. Install it via pip (may introduce an additional dependency on pip)
1. Install it via yum and use the shell command to handle the input

Push notifications need a .entitlements file on Xcode 8 When using Xcode 8, push notifications won't work if you don't have a .entitlements file on the project with the "aps-environment" key

Xcode can fix it on the Capabilities section of the target, but it should be documented or maybe find a way to create and link that file ourselves.
Button to take picture doesn't work on Shoot app The button to take pictures doesn't work on Shoot app on iOS 11 devices.

Push notifications need a .entitlements file on Xcode 8 When using Xcode 8, push notifications won't work if you don't have a .entitlements file on the project with the "aps-environment" key

Xcode can fix it on the Capabilities section of the target, but you shouldn't really open the Xcode project and change things on a Cordova app, this should be created/copied/filled by a hook
